cetus.analysis
Class InlineExpansion

java.lang.Object
  cetus.analysis.InlineExpansion

public class InlineExpansion
extends java.lang.Object

Performs simple function inlining. It assumes that the code to be inlined is already compiled correctly and has no errors. Following are taken care of: * Functions that result in recursion are not inlined * Functions that use static external variables are not inlined * Global variables used in the function to be inlined are handled by declaring them as extern * Variable reshaping (array-dimensions) is handled * Long function call chains (a->b->c->d->...) are handled as long as they do not result in a recursion * Switches are provided for controlling variable names and their length * Support for making log * Comments with the inlined code

inline

public void inline(Procedure proc)
performs inlining in the body of the function passed, after performing inlining in the functions in the call graph of this function. does so in a bottom up fashion. Clients that are only interested in one-level inlining should call the inlineFunction instead. Following are taken care of: * Functions that result in recursion are not inlined * Functions that use static external variables are not inlined * Global variables used in the function to be inlined are handled by declaring them as extern * Variable reshaping (array-dimensions) is handled * Long function call chains (a->b->c->d->...) are handled as long as they do not result in a recursion * Switches are provided for controlling variable names and their lengths * Support for making log * Comments with the inlined code

Parameters:
proc - - the function in whose code, inlining is to be performed, usually the main function

inlineFunction

public void inlineFunction(Procedure proc,
                           CallGraph callGraph)
inlines the function calls in the body of the given procedure, doesn't go deeper than that i.e. does not inline functions called by the procedure recursively.

Parameters:
proc - - the procedure
callGraph - - the call graph, using call graph this method makes sure that the function calls that result in recursion - are not inlined. If that is not a concern, clients can pass null for this parameter Following are taken care of: * Function calls that result in recursion are not inlined (it can be bypassed by passing null for the call graph) * Functions that use static external variables are not inlined * Global variables used in the function to be inlined are handled by declaring them as extern * Variable reshaping (array-dimensions) is handled * Switches are provided for controlling variable names and their lengths * Support for making log * Comments with the inlined code
